author: jochembrouwer
content:
Cool this is basically what EthJS also wants to do (for Prague, but also for EOF). 
Did you run the codecov reporter with any fancy flags? https://app.codecov.io/gh/ethereum/evmone/commit/26cdd854106cbcbb4d817cfd5e0d2b1ee41bcd21/tree/lib/evmone?flags%5B0%5D=eof_execution_spec_tests&flags%5B1%5D=ethereum_tests&dropdown=coverage (can I see this somewhere?)

author: jochembrouwer
content: I'm mainly interested in things like branching factor and how this is being reported (I'm not sure if I'm using the correct term here). So for instance if you have `if (a or b)` then this would "branch" on a=true and b arbitrary but also b=true and a arbitrary. And if some of this is not hit, then it would flag it as not completely covered (might also be called something different than branching factor, should study coverage terms)
